roleset.name: assign a label or attribute, describing something as having a label or attribute
roleset.note: CHARACTERIZE-V NOTES: Latter could be considered a different roleset/sense. (from characterize.01-v)

example.name: typical transitive
example.text: William R. Laidig, Nekoosa's chairman, chief executive officer and president, characterized the $58-a-share bid as ``uninvited.''
example.arg: William R. Laidig, Nekoosa's chairman, chief executive officer and president,

example.name: lacking attribute
example.text: Anheuser noted that ``beer industry sales volume in 1989 is following the trend [*T*} that has characterized the last half of the '80s.

role.descr: possessor of quality, characteristic of whom (should come SECOND)

example.name: dialectal linguistics, Args 1 and 2
example.text: That accent is characteristic of Northern people.
